DataElement.preferredName: Participant Recruitment Healthcare Facility Medical Specialty Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the medical specialty of the health care facility recruiting patients.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Recruitment Healthcare Facility Medical Specialty
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity._The process of enrolling, enlisting, or adding individuals to a group._The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided._The branches of medical science that deal with nonsurgical techniques.

The process of enrolling, enlisting, or adding individuals to a group.
The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

Property.preferredDefinition: Medical Specialty; the branches of medical science that deal with nonsurgical techniques.

Concepts.definition: An area of specialized study within the broader practice of medicine and surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept to value meaning. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The branch of medicine concerned with the treatment of infants and children.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medicine concerned with the treatment of infants and children.

PermissibleValues.value: Adult Primary Care (Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Obstetrics and Gynecology)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Health services that meet most basic health care needs over time. Primary care includes physical exams, treatment of common medical conditions, and preventive care such as immunizations and screenings. Primary care doctors are usually the first health professionals patients see for basic medical care. They may refer a patient to a specialist if needed.: A human who has reached reproductive age.

Concepts.definition: Health services that meet most basic health care needs over time. Primary care includes physical exams, treatment of common medical conditions, and preventive care such as immunizations and screenings. Primary care doctors are usually the first health professionals patients see for basic medical care. They may refer a patient to a specialist if needed.
An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The branch of medicine dealing with the heart and its diseases.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medicine dealing with the heart and its diseases.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The medical science that deals with the origin, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of mental disorders.

Concepts.definition: The medical specialty that deals with the medical management of mental disorders.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Palliative care is the patient-and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Traditional models reflect abandonment of proactive treatment and a simultaneous increase in symptom control and comfort-related services, as a disease progressed in linear fashion through its course. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.

Concepts.definition: The patient- and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural functional changes that result from disease processes.  Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The branch of medical science dealing with the medical use of X-rays or other penetrating radiation.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science dealing with the medical use of X-rays or other penetrating radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The medical specialty concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases of the genitourinary tract.

Concepts.definition: The medical specialty concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases of the genitourinary tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The branch of oncology concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of cancer of the genitourinary tract.

Concepts.definition: The branch of oncology concerned with the study, diagnosis, and treatment of cancer of the genitourinary tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The branch of oncology that focuses on tumors of the reproductive tract of women.

Concepts.definition: The branch of oncology that focuses on tumors of the reproductive tract of women.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intervention studies in which surgery is the dominant feature to prevent, diagnose, stage, or treat cancer (except neurosurgery and eye surgery).  Includes special devices for dividing or destroying tissues, development and improvement of instruments for detection and diagnosis of tumors where surgery/biopsy is the dominant feature, cytoreductive procedures, intraoperative radiotherapy, surgical treatment of cancer and its complications, surgical supportive care, and plastic reconstructive and rehabilitation surgery.

Concepts.definition: Intervention studies in which surgery is the dominant feature to prevent, diagnose, stage, or treat cancer (except neurosurgery and eye surgery).  Includes special devices for dividing or destroying tissues, development and improvement of instruments for detection and diagnosis of tumors where surgery/biopsy is the dominant feature, cytoreductive procedures, intraoperative radiotherapy, surgical treatment of cancer and its complications, surgical supportive care, and plastic reconstructive and rehabilitation surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subspecialty of medical oncology and radiology concerned with the radiotherapy of cancer.

Concepts.definition: The study of the effects of ionizing radiation for treatment of tumors.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or related to the aged or to characteristics of the aging process.: The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.

Concepts.definition: Of or related to the aged or to characteristics of the aging process.
The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The study and treatment of cancers with chemicals, biological products or immunotherapy.

Concepts.definition: The study and treatment of cancers with chemicals, biological products or immunotherapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The medical specialty that focuses on tumors in children.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: The medical specialty that focuses on tumors in children.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.
